name: Morepork Riverside Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Happy as can be, ( to music Ha ha ) Yes fantastic to be back at Morepork to see Barbara and Paul. (our 4th Visit )
reviews.title: Here we went Again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Its all been said before,its still 5 * and more. Just read all others reviews and you will not be disappointed., all true.
reviews.title: A perfect end to a wonderful trip to New Zealand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there the full 7 nights,feel like part of the family. You are always introduced to new guests and soon feel at home.We were there for ANZAC day, special dinner ''party'' see photo.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
Don't even consider staying anyplace else!
reviews.text: A great night. Still found many places to visit,all easy drives from Morepork. Some re-visits and in more depth. We went out for meals only a few nights (too well wined and dined Hic Ha ha ).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Went to ''The Italian'' and ''Wharepuke'' both restaurants in Kerikeri Excellent I will also review,
reviews.title: Superb B&B
Natural Hosts!
reviews.text: We (couple plus 12 year old daughter) stayed one night at this delightful lodge in December 2012. We were in the Riverview room - very spacious, comfortable and a lovely big bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great as the accommodation was, however, what really stood out for me was the welcome we received from our hosts Paul and Barbara, who were clearly put on this earth to run a B&B - even though they seem to do a million and one other things as well. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Nothing to do with pigs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seven days in February and the highlight of our five week trip. We were very impressed with NZ B & Bs in general but this one took the biscuit. Paul and Barbara could not have been more welcoming. Every time we came in Paul was there to check all had gone well and to offer tea, coffee stickies etc. Given notice they will cook dinner and dine with you. If that is a concern I can tell you they are excellent company. The room was spacious as was the bathroom. View excellent although nowhere near the sea. Breakfast was wonderful and Paul even had a go at reproducing my favourite school one - how thoughtful. A word of warning - NZ Marmite is not proper Marmite!
reviews.title: Return to paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed with Paul and Barbara five years ago we were so pleased to be back there again for a three night stay.We were welcomed as old friends and instantly felt at home. Morepork Lodge has developed so well since our previous visit and we were treated to a conducted tour of the grounds and introduced to all the animals including my namesake chicken!!
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is hard to improve on perfection but both of our hosts always go the extra mile to ensure that everyone has a memorable experience.We are already saving for our next visit and cannot recommend Morepork Lodge more highly for an unforgetable visit to the Bay of Islands.You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 100% perfect reviews on TripAdvisor? Are you kidding? We couldn't believe it, so booked the place to begin our tour of New Zealand.
reviews.title: Pretty darned near perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we drove southward after our three nights at Morepork, my wife and I tried to think of a B&B that topped this one during our travels. We reminisced about some of the great B&B experiences we have had, but in the end agreed that none had ever bested this one. From the helpful information given by Paul and Barbara before and during our visit to the personal tour of the beautifully manicured grounds, we had the perfect hosts. This couple knows how to treat their guests as a sort of combination of royalty and family members. Their home is spotless, comfortable, convenient to town and the sights, and habitat to everything from the alpacas to the morepork owls out back to the dozens of varieties of native plants.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hospitality, Superb Accommodation and Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paul is an accomplished chef, who served an amazing meal one night to us and two other couples. The made-to-order breakfasts were delicious, and the table was piled with far more food than any of us could eat. Just enjoying the view from the back porch of the river below and the hills in the background was worth doing. Wi-fi was excellent; the bottle of complimentary wine in the little mini-fridge hit the spot. And the two hosts were extremely helpful in recommending places and restaurants for us. We really were made to feel like family, and there was absolutely nothing we would have changed about our stay at this wonderful place. It was a great way to begin our visit to this beautiful country.
reviews.title: Warmth, hospitality, excellent amenities & delicious food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Thank you for everything, Paul and Barbara!
reviews.title: Very welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Morepark Riverside Lodge sets the benchmark for us from now on.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is unknown for me to give out top marks for anything, but Morepork Lodge is the exception. From walking in, and being greeted with the welcome tea and cakes to leaving after a fantastic breakfast, the experience was excellent. Hosts Paul and Barbara have the knack of knowing when to join in with the guests and when to 'disappear'. Paul cooks an excellent evening meal if you want, and me being a vegetarian didn't cause a problem. In fact he charged me less for my meal than the carnivores. Their suggestions on where to go and visit was very helpful, and the flight up to the norht cape was the highlight of our trip.
reviews.title: You have to stay there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location with hospitality to match Morepork is one of the best stay we had in our entire trip at New Zealand. Well done room with beautiful interiors not only make us feel cosy but give us the perfect family ambience away from our home. We loved our hosts and enjoyed their culinary skills . The animals were fun to be with. A small stream with a lush garden made the entire place look picturesque . Our trip back to Paihia will certainly have Morepork as a stay on our list. All the best to Paul & Barbara and a big thank you for their hospitality.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can only add to all the previous postings, this homestay is outstanding. Just to sit on the balcony in the early evening looking over the lovely garden while Paul cooks one of his excellent evening meals; life doesn't come better.
reviews.title: So nice to come home to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We very highly recommend Morepork Lodge.
reviews.title: It doesn't get better than this!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Morepork Lodge is the best homestay/b&b we have ever stayed in . Hosts Paul and Barbara make guests so welcome and nothing is too much trouble. They think of everything - even the bottles of water waiting on the car roof each morning. Their home is beautiful and our bedroom with ensuite and balcony overlooking their magnificent garden was perfect. And they can both certainly cook!! The breakfasts will keep you going all day and evening dinners were absolutely delicious - and great fun! They have resident animals at the top of the garden which can be fed by guests and don't forget to visit the Moreporks who live in the woods at the bottom of the garden. All in all, an amazing place run by an amazing couple. Thank you Barbara and Paul - we will certainly book again when we next visit New Zealand.
reviews.title: A Perfect Choice!
Magic
reviews.text: Spent 6 nights in absolute comfort. Quiet location , fabulous hosts who provided 2 superb home cooked meals.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are amazing and it's so nice to sit on ones own deck with a drink enjoying the view.
reviews.title: The best B@B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Highly recommended ,Paul & Barbara can't do enough to make you feel at home and comfortable.
reviews.title: Exactly !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Don't miss.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started our trip here and it has spoilt us for anywhere else. Barbara and Paul are excellent hosts and made us feel instantly at home. Their local advice was indispensable. Our room (the Waitangi) had a lovely view over the river valley to the fields opposite and was very comfortable. Dinner was excellent and it was lovely to be able to eat with our hosts and other guests. The breakfasts were also excellent and set us up for the day. I cannot recommend this B&B highly enough. I wish we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Return to Morepork 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although a few minutes drive out of Paihia, very warm welcome with tea and cake. Very comfortable new and well appointed room, and lovely garden, including morepork owls, with hens, goat and alpacas. Advised and booked our memorable Bay of Islands cruise trip. Hosted a lovely family dinner. Great support with laundry. Home from home.
reviews.title: Enthusiastic Welcome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent four nights with Paul and Barbara and we could not have asked for more welcoming and better hosts. They have quite literally thought of everything that a B&B traveller could need, right down to the ice and lime for a G&T! The breakfasts and evening meals were all excellent. Our room was large with a spotless en suite and it overlooked the garden. David went out of his way to advise us on places to visit after taking the trouble to understand our interests. Morepork is very well positioned to reach Pahia seafront (5mins) and the roads leading north and west for day tripping. This B&B lives up to its top billing.
reviews.title: First rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tom and Valerie Fowle
reviews.title: Gold in Paihia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Uxbridge
reviews.title: Service, Comfort and Morepork Owls in the Garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ontario
reviews.title: Unsurpassed in Paihia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Such a warm welcome from Paul and Barbara! We stayed for three nights with our two year old who loved the animals and we all loved the beautiful gardens. Paul is a terrific cook ( I recommend the chocolate mousse!) and so accommodating of all our requests. The room had everything you could need. Thanks for a super time. We will recommend to others.
reviews.title: What a wonderful time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: The welcome made us feel special. On our tour round the delightful grounds we saw the Morepork! Chissed Pook (Beer Barbequed Chicken) and the Lamb we had for dinner were both fantastic.
reviews.title: Paul and Barbara were superb hosts and we want to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts set us up for the day. Help with bookings was great.
reviews.title: Awsome stay at Morepork Riverside Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed every minute of it! The hosts gave us a warm welcome and are so friendly. The location is just breathtaking and the rooms are spacious, clean and have everything you need.
reviews.title: Great stay at Morepork Riverside Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We would recommend this place to everyone.
reviews.title: Top host!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back for our 3rd Visit,Wow what a welcome.Even a notice board outside welcoming us. Yippee what a lovely feeling returning to see friends,which is what all guests say of, Barbara and Paul.( 2 of the Best ) You will have read all the other reviews,so I can not add any other comments that have not been said before. ''Simply the Best ''
reviews.title: Creme de la creme

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there for 7 nights ( lucky us ) eating with them most nights,which were great memorable nights. Went out to eat 2 nights,to '' Seafood Only'' and ''The Italians'' both Good.
reviews.title: Excellent end to our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to many different places without going to places we had visited before.Paul and Barbara will tell you about all the places to visit. Yes you will never get bored up there, its great.Cant wait to go back. P.S Notice their Clock ! you don't know whether you are coming or going Ha Ha.
reviews.title: A must!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank You Barbara and Paul for a wonderful time.
reviews.title: PERFECT ACCOMODATIONS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ( Barry ''Morepork Club '' founder member Ha Ha )
reviews.title: Brilliant in all respects

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paul was handling things himself whilst Barbara was out of town for a few days. He still managed to deliver top quality service looking after us very well. The rooms are very well equipped with everythhing you may need. Breakfast was superb and you get all the help you need in planning your days. There is great attention to detail in a very informal atmosphere
reviews.title: A welcoming home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay outside Paihia was relaxing - enhanced by the beauty of the country - and fulfilling, as our hosts offered the most complete suggestions of where to visit based on our interests including driving directions and restaurant suggestions. Paul managed to locate the tripod we left behind at the Kauri forest and put us in touch with the supervisor there so we could retrieve it later on our way back. Such personalized attention is truly hard to find and is greatly appreciated.
reviews.title: Top notch individual attention was provided by owners Barbara and Paul.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 2 night stay at Morepork Lodge in the Riverview room was truly exceptional. On arrival Barbara & Paul made us feel so welcome in their lovely home in the quiet countryside, a short drive outside Paihia. Our room was large, extremely comfortable, spotlessly clean with a beautiful view of the garden down to the river and beyond. We explored the grounds and visited Anzac and Tim Tam, the resident alpacas, and Pollux the goat who put on a display of acrobatics for us. Prior to our trip to NZ, Barbara & Paul sent us lots of information on places to visit, things to do and made reservations for us. A gourmet breakfast of freshly squeezed orange juice, fresh fruits, muffins, breads, yogurt, cereals, bacon, eggs of your choice greeted us each morning. A great way to start the day with lots of lively conversation and humour.
reviews.title: The Best of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Barbara and Paul are wonderful hosts who provide those special touches that make your stay so enjoyable. Don't miss out on this great B & B when you visit the Bay of Islands.
reviews.title: The perfect spot to unwind and enjoy the bay of islands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: I have never had customer service that equals the wonderful welcoming and accomodating service provided here by Paul and Barbara. I work in events and have stayed in some incredible 5 star hotels but not one of them could rival the amazing service Paul and Barbara provided to us as guests. Nothing was too much to ask and being greeted with a homemade muffin on arrival sealed the deal. The grounds are impressive, the bedrooms spacious and clean, and its only a 10 minute drive into Paihia and the bay. Far enough to be out of the hustle and bustle but not too far to be convenient. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: The best place we stayed in New Zealand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights, which really wasn't long enough!!! Our room had a sweeping view of the garden and river which we could enjoy with a glass of wine on our sundeck. The room itself was clean, tasteful, and included a fridge (essential for keeping the wine cool for post exercise recovery). We were also welcome to make use of the lounge and dining room area, which was great for swapping stories with the other guests.
reviews.title: Paul and Barbara's lovely home and hospitality made this the highlight of the North Island!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the gardens Paul has built a number of walks including marked areas where the resident Morepork perches (we saw him). These lead round to the Alpacas, Sheep, and goat which we helped to feed. The Alpacas (Anzac and Timtam) were really friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was served at a large communal table with the other guests and Barbara made sure you never went hungry. We were lucky enough to join Paul and Barbara for and evening meal with the other guests (separate cost, but very reasonable) which was cooked excellently and accompanied by fantastic wine. Sarah may never forget the choc mousse! If it's available, I would highly recommend this!
reviews.title: Morepork Lodge is exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to arriving, Paul and Barbara emailed us to ask if we were still interested in sailing (we mentioned this when we booked) and pencilled us in on Gunga II (also great) for the next day. They really thought of everything and made sure we had a great time!
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning - place and hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Morepork the end of February 2011. Paul looked after us during our stay (Barbara was away at the time). I have never experienced hospitality like it. After a rather awful journey to Paihia, Paul greeted us with infectious enthusiasm and delicious blueberry muffins.
reviews.title: Bona fide home from home - wish we'd stayed longer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: From beginning to end Paul and Barbara provide a service that is always better than you can reasonably expect. All the extras are too numerous to mention -they only add to the experience which is based on a super room, great food and 2 of the most positive and good humoured people you could wish to meet. Nobody could experience Morepork without feeling cheered by the whole experience.
reviews.title: super B&B in a lovely settig

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in our driving tour of New Zealand. Lovely spot. The house is on high ground overlooking a river and beautiful countryside. The rooms open onto a deck with the view. Paul and Barbara are lovely people, who serve a great breakfast and also a great dinner (optional) which we had.
reviews.title: Nice room with deck, gorgeous rural view, good food, good people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little out of Paihia, Morepork is ideally located for exploring the region. Paul and Barbara are great hosts and nothing is too much trouble – they’ll even prepare a very nice evening meal for you, so long as you order it at breakfast. They also thought of the little things like providing bottles of ice-cold water for our day’s activity. Their house is situated in a lovely riverside location and the rooms very comfortable and spacious. Paul arranged an afternoon cruise for us around the Bay of Islands to see dolphins and the ‘Hole in the Rock’ at Cape Brett. We had spent the morning in the charming, historic seaside village of Russell, having caught the ferry from Paihia (don’t bother to drive there). Russell also has a number of very good beachfront restaurants. Also if you’re heading in the direction of Cape Reigna, fish and chips at Manganui is a must! Morepork was one of our favourite b&bs during our month long tour of both the South and North Islands and was a great place to finish our holiday (apart from a night in Auckland).
reviews.title: It's the little things that count!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Morepork Riverside Lodge is an absolute gem - unique among B and Bs. If you visit the beautiful Bay of Islands, we would unreservedly recommend you to stay here. This home, with its grounds, is outstanding.
reviews.title: If you visit the Bay of Islands, this is surely the best place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paul and Barbara are delightful hosts and their local knowledge and generosity were much appreciated. We particularly enjoyed a morning pre breakfast walk with Paul to the Harua Falls - and especially the delicious pancakes awaiting us upon our return! Paul and Barbara are first rate chefs and form a great team. We were most impressed with one of their so called 'light meals' - excellent cuisine, well presented and great value.
reviews.title: Beautiful oasis central to Bay of Islands topspots. Worth the money
We've never had a better B & B experience anywhere in the world.
reviews.text: It doesn't get any better than this: a wonderful B & B in a gorgeous rural setting on the outskirts of Paihia. The rooms were nicely appointed and the food excellent. Barbara and Paul were fantastic hosts. You can tell they thoroughly enjoy operating a B & B. Not only did they guide us on things to do in the area and places to dine, but Paul was kind enough to take us on a guided hike. The cold water bottles they provided each morning were a nice touch. I can't say enough about the beauty of the Bay of Islands, clearly the most beautiful spot on the entire north island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night at Morepork Riverside Lodge (Paihia) on pleasure trip to Bay of Islands.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hosts and Superb Accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Barbara and Paul welcomed us at the front door. Lovely couple who obviously enjoy their B n B accommodation.
reviews.title: DREAM HOLIDAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautifully presented rooms with fabulous river/country views.
reviews.title: Hospitality Second to None! Amazing Place and Amazing Hosts!
Wonderful Caring Owners
reviews.text: While we explored the immaculate gardens, two slices of freshly made cake appeared on our bedside table.. Nice touch and most appreciated.

aka: Morepork Riverside Lodge Paihia, Bay Of Islands
description: Welcome to our B&B/Homestay set in 4 acres on the Waitangi River, just out of Paihia Township on the way to Kerikeri. Stroll through gardens & native bush, home to many birds including Moreporks (NZ’s native owl). Tame alpacas, sheep and a goat. All rooms have a king or super king bed, en-suite (one with a large corner bath), TV&DVD, tea & coffee, refrigerator & wireless broadband. Our two river side rooms also have their own deck and a sofa. Puketona room guests have use of a table & chairs on our BBQ deck. Yummy full breakfasts. Gourmet or Light evening meals available. We are "Kiwis" and have traveled extensively throughout NZ and the Pacific.
